definition.name: NXspm_bias_spectroscopy
definition.doc:
A base class for bias spectroscopy to describe the change in the physical properties of the sample with respect to the sweep voltage applied on a sample of STM/AFM/... experiments.
In these experiments an electric potential is applied between the (conductive) sample and the probe (tip), and the physical properties (e.g. tunnelling current) are measured as the function of this potential. The potential is varied in so-called voltage sweeps and the corresponding properties are recorded accordingly.

field.name: measurement_type
field.doc: The measurement type defines how current is measured under the different input variables like bias voltage (constant_spacing) or height (variadic_spacing) is applied during the measurement.

field.name: identifier_environment
field.doc: Unique identifier for the environment defined by the user or lab. When multiple scans are performed in a single environment conditions or settings, the entire scan environment can be differentiated by this identifier. For example, scan on a sample of TiSe2 with layered of evaporated pyrene and annealed at 300K temperature for 5 min process.

group.doc:
Information about the positioner PID (proportional, integral, differential feedback system), offset values, setpoint values and so on, while running bias voltage-tunneling current measurement.
These components position the probe relative to the sample, thus help obtaining maps of the data across the sample surface.

field.name: acquisition_time
field.doc: The time or period (average) to acquire the data for a single bias sweep point.

field.name: animation_time
field.doc: The time or period a bias sweep to be displayed.

field.name: measurement_time
field.doc: The time or period taken by the circuit to measure a full bias sweep (duration of the voltage-current measurement measurement).

group.name: BIAS_SWEEP
group.doc: The bias sweep scan which is is performed in the scanning probe microscopy experiments.

group.name: spatial_location
group.doc: The spatial location of the scan points. This would be recommended to use if there are multiple bias sweep scans at different locations.

field.name: scan_type
field.doc: This combines not only how the voltages are changed, but how the voltage values are correlated to a position across the sample surface, measuring sweeps are each spatial coordinate or mapping the response at constant voltage, etc. For STS experiment, the scan type is usually a single-point scan (trajectory scan).

field.name: number_of_sweeps
field.doc: The number of sweeps (a full scan from starting bias to end bias) taken during the bias spectroscopy.

field.name: first_settling_time
field.doc: The initial time taken to settle the bias voltage at the desired value. On each sweep usually, the system takes time to settle to the bias voltage at the next value.

field.name: end_settling_time
field.doc: The time (at the last sweep) to settle for the last value of the sweep.

field.name: settling_time
field.doc: The time taken to settle the bias voltage at the desired value. On each sweep usually, the system takes time to settle the bias voltage at the next value.

field.name: max_slew_rate
field.doc: The rate at which the amplifier responds to the voltage change (to reach at the desired value). It defines if the tip movement and voltage sweep are synchronized.

field.name: final_z
field.doc: The z position after the sweeps are done.

field.name: total_spectroscopy_time
field.doc: The total time needed for the entire voltage sweep.

group.name: scan_region
group.doc: The scan region is the area of phase space or sub-phase space where the scan is performed.

field.name: scan_offset_bias
field.doc: The starting voltage of the bias sweep. The range of voltages for the sweep can be defined with scan voltage offset and scan voltage range (difference between minimum and maximum voltage values in a sweep)

field.name: scan_range_bias
field.doc: The range of voltages for the sweep can be defined with scan voltage offset and scan voltage range (difference between minimum and maximum voltage values in a sweep)

field.name: scan_start_bias
field.doc: The start of the bias scan voltage.

field.name: scan_end_bias
field.doc: The end value of the bias scan voltage.

group.name: linear_sweep
group.doc: In the linear sweep, the bias voltage is changed linearly from the start value to the end value.

field.name: backward_sweep
field.doc: If the bias voltage sweep is also performed in the opposite direction.

field.name: scan_points_bias
field.doc: The number of voltage points per sweep.

field.name: step_size_bias
field.doc: The step size between the two consecutive bias voltage values during the sweep.

field.name: scan_time
field.doc: The time taken by the scanner to scan the entire area.

field.name: reset_bias
field.doc: The reset_bias defines whether the bias voltage should be reset to the starting value after the sweep is completed.

group.doc:
The scan data is the data collected during the scan. If the scan has several channels or derivatives from the channel data, please duplicate this NXdata group for each.
To define specific current or voltage use :ref:`DATA </NXdata/DATA-field>` and :ref:`AXISNAME </NXdata/AXISNAME-field>`.
